FuncDef: The display ipv6 routing-table verbose command displays information about an IPv6 routing table. The display ipv6 routing-table verbose command displays information about an IPv6 routing table. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display ipv6 routing-table [ table-namemsr ] [ time-range <min-age> <max-age> ] verbose

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a routing table.
-

Displays routes that are generated within a specified period.
-

Specifies the start generation time.
The value is a character string in the format of XXdXXhXXmXXs.

Specifies the end generation time.
The value is a character string in the format of XXdXXhXXmXXs.

Displays details about all active and inactive routes in the current routing table.
-

Indicates the multicast static routing table.
-
